description: This is a Kotlin source file defining the MenuFragment class, which is a UI component in an Android application. It manages the display of a restaurant's menu, including category filtering via chips, displaying menu items in a RecyclerView, and handling user interactions such as adding items to the cart, toggling favorites, and adjusting quantities. The fragment also interacts with repositories for cart and favorites management and sets up UI elements like title, meta info, and category chips.

classes.name: MenuFragment
classes.description: A Fragment that displays a restaurant's menu, allows filtering by category, and handles adding items to the cart with configurable options and favorites toggling.

methods.name: onCreate
methods.description: Initializes the adapter and sets up click handlers for menu item interactions.

methods.name: onCreateView
methods.description: Inflates the fragment layout from XML.

methods.name: onViewCreated
methods.description: Initializes UI components, sets up the restaurant info, category chips, recycler view, and observes data changes.

methods.name: setupCategoryChips
methods.description: Creates category filters as chips for filtering displayed menu items.

methods.name: openOptionsAndAdd
methods.description: Shows a bottom sheet for item options and adds configured items to the cart.

methods.name: newInstance
methods.description: Creates a new instance of MenuFragment with the specified restaurant ID.
